sections.heading: Child Abduction; Broadcast.
sections.text:
A radio or television station receiving information concerning a child abduction from the Michigan state police pursuant to the Amber alert of Michigan act may broadcast that information in any manner designed to assist in the location of the abducted child or apprehension of any suspect.

History:2002, Act 713, Imd. Eff. Dec. 30, 2002

sections.heading: Information to Be Broadcast.
sections.text:
The information to be broadcast by a radio or television station under section 2 includes all of the information provided by the Michigan state police.

History:2002, Act 713, Imd. Eff. Dec. 30, 2002

sections.heading: Radio and Television Stations to Which Information Provided; Method.
sections.text:
The information shall be provided to predetermined radio and television stations by a method agreed to by the Michigan state police and the Michigan association of broadcasters.

History:2002, Act 713, Imd. Eff. Dec. 30, 2002

sections.heading: Liability; Immunity.
sections.text:
A radio or television station that accurately broadcasts information concerning a child abduction obtained from the Michigan state police pursuant to the Amber alert of Michigan is immune from any liability based on the broadcast of that information.

History:2002, Act 713, Imd. Eff. Dec. 30, 2002
